briefTitle: Research Study Comparing a New Medicine Semaglutide to Liraglutide in People With Type 2 Diabetes
officialTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Semaglutide 1.0 mg Once-weekly Versus Liraglutide 1.2 mg Once-daily as add-on to 1-3 Oral Anti-diabetic Drugs (OADs) in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes
summary: This study is conducted in Europe. The aim of the study is to compare the effect of semaglutide subcutaneous (s.c., under the skin) 1.0 mg once-weekly to liraglutide s.c.1.2 mg once-daily on blood sugar levels after 30 weeks of treatment in people with type 2 diabetes. The study will last approximately 9 months (37 weeks). Each participant will have 7 visits at the clinic and 3 phone calls with the study doctor. At the visits, participants will have a number of tests, for example: general health checks, blood samples, heart and eye checks etc. Participants will also fill in some forms about their health and satisfaction with their diabetes treatment.
